page.title: 06CRANHAM COMMON
page.content: Cranham Common is a big grassland. It is owned by Major Birchall and Mr. Workman. It is about 90 acres and is in 4 main areas. We have three different types of orchid - bee orchid , pyramid orchid and butterfly orchid. There also are cowslips on our common. In the summer cows graze on the common from farms around the village. We have two types of snakes and one type of lizard - adders, grass snakes and common lizards. There are a few trees on our common, mainly Silver Birch and Hazel. A fire for Guy Fawkes Night is held right on the top of the common. Near that place is the cricket field. We have lots of horses ridden on the common, and a riding school situated on the common, owned by Mrs. Hemming.
